content: lichen & moss shawl by sue lazenby medium version inspired by patterns of lichen & moss this is a highly textured shawl in 2 sizes lichen stitch is paired with moss stitch bands which are accentuated by reverse stocking stitch these contrast with the wide central garter stitch panel this makes an interesting yet easy knit for the advanced beginner a versatile shawl that can be worked in a variety of yarns from fingering through to worsted weight it is best worked in a solid yarn to show the textured patterns well © 2014 sue lazenby suseknits all rights reserved this pattern is intended for personal use only and may not be sold or copied for other purposes items made from this pattern may be sold please credit the designer lichen & moss shawl page 1 finished measurements medium large width approx 46 / 117 cm 63 / 160 cm depth approx 20 / 51 cm 26 / 66 cm materials approximately 400 - 29sts / 38 row = 4 /10 cm measured over lichen stitch pattern using fingering weight on 4 mm needles before blocking 20 22 sts / 36 row = 4 / 10 cm measured over lichen stitch pattern using fingering weight on 4 mm needles after blocking gauge is not critical and is a personal choice depending on chosen yarn although this may change overall measurements abbreviations bobble bind off p purl c2f cross two stitches at front knit into p2tog purl 2 sts together front of second stitch then knit the first stitch slipping both off at the same time pm place marker co cast on repeat repeat k knit ws wrong side m marker m1l make 1 st leaning left insert right rs right side needle into bar between stitches from front to back place stitch on left needle slm slip marker with leading leg in front knit into the back of stitch twisting it m1r make 1 stitch leaning right insert right needle into bar between stitches from front to back place stitch on left needle with leading leg at back knit into the front of stitch twisting it lichen & moss shawl page 2 pattern notes the shawl is knitted top down starting with a garter tab 4 sts are increased on rs row only with 4 st garter edges and a central 8 st garter band worked
